comments.commentBody: This would make sense if the United States were allowed to close Guantanamo, legally. Unfortunately, that facility must be outside the realm of space and time.

And if they are on the terrorist watch list, that's OK with you too?  A "well regulated militia" is not the same as letting anyone who wants one get a gun that will fire multiple shots in less than a minute.  There's a lot of it about.  Don't you think there are better things to do than worry about the guy next door or his children or wife having a bad day and going on a shooting spree?
Good thoughts Richard.
Best not to take a job that requires these kinds of hours, rather than accepting it, and the money and perks that come with it, and then complaining about it.

Just today I got an email asking me to make an appointment for a phone interview at a firm where I'd applied for a position. At the website Glassdoor, seven employees rated their firm; all gave it the highest, 5-star rating. But the first reviewer, who loved his or her job and called the company "a great place to work," wrote, "The cons are very scarce, but the most notable issue seems to be the sometimes-skewed work/life balance." All but one of the seven glowing reviews mentioned this "work/life balance" issue or called it "long hours (80 hours a week)" or said "free time is hard to come by" or something like that.

I am thinking of canceling the phone interview after reading those reviews. I will be 65 in six months -- one reason I'm shocked I was chosen for an interview -- and if I've never wanted a job like that one, I certainly don't at this stage of my life.

.
.

sorry about the OT.  The rest of it is good, but I am bored bored bored with Trump.  He's so ugly and so vain.

When in Rome...

If I were lucky enough to move to Paris, I would learn to speak French, obey their laws, follow their customs, celebrate their holidays, dress as they do, and do everything I could to adapt to the culture I freely chose.

Otherwise, it would seem that I only want the benefits of living in France and none of the responsibilities.

If I do that, eventually my hosts will see me as ungrateful and a net loss to their society.

Why would anyone want that?

I plan to wear a Bernie t-shirt that declares,"Political Revolution,"
and has a list of his issues stenciled on the front. I don't feel threatened however since Thanksgiving will be in Portland, Oregon with friends and relatives
who are of the similar political persuasion.

WaPo has come out swinging, but I'm sick of "fair and balanced". It's time to be just plain fair, fair to everyone.

it calls for kosher salt, use that. iodized table not much different.

"your people" - this term alone tells you all we need to know about your  irrational logic. As if all muslims hang out at the SAME country club. As if they all KNOW EACH OTHER? Are you freaking kidding me with this nonsense? Where do you get off blaming followers of DIFFERENT SECTS of a huge umbrella of the islam religion living half a world away? Who do you think you are? If enough white people complain about police brutality, does that mean racism will end? If enough men condemn rape, does that mean rape will end? The fact that you got so many upvotes is disturbing.

Portland is an amazing city today. We spend a few days there almost every summer. It was always ahead of its time.

I'm bearing up reasonably well but all hell breaks loose tomorrow. Have a great Thanksgiving, John and everyone!
Very good. Used the fennel bulb, veggie broth and spinach options. Needs more than a pinch of red pepper flakes or maybe a bit more salt & pepper.
And Hillary Clinton would never stoop to that right!  Glad we straightened that out

Trump says what HE wants to hear, HE talks to Himself all the time.As an an extreme Egotist Himself just expects everyone to be listening in awe. I can just hear his inner voice as his lips flap in the breeze with his brain in neutral, Yeh  thats the ticket.
And indeed, these followers are extremely stupid!

Trump is saying what his followers want to hear.

When I made it, it wasn't soupy at all.
It worked nicely with spinach. I think it needs either more than just a pinch of red pepper or more salt and pepper or maybe both?
Looks like they fixed it.  Good eye!

I hope you did not try 1/2 c butter in this struesel, it contains no flour so the 1/2 Tbs. is correct (otherwise you would end up with a greasy mess) - this is a wonderful recipe - highly recommend it as it is.
I agree with Liz. A whole stick (1/2 cup) of butter in the streusel is not advised.

I suspect that the "1/2 tablespoon butter" under "Struesel" should read "1/2 C butter", as this is closer to the amounts used in other recipes, and the quantity specified can neither be cut with a pastry blender, nor be sufficient to provide the moisture to make the struesel mixture crumbly.
Really? Frankly there are at least 240,000,000 gun owners in the US, if the majority of you wanted mass shootings to end it would.

Yes, the U.S. Constitution protects freedom of religion but Islam as it is currently practised does not accept a person's freedom to choose, if he or she was born a Muslim. To abandon one's Muslim faith and convert to another one is committing the crime of apostasy. In many Muslim nation states, this crime is punishable by death, or, if you're lucky, jail.

Presumably the majority accept this tenet because it has not been dismantled or challenged vigorously by activists.

I practice no religion and hold no religious views, but I personally don't feel intruded upon by others who pray in public places, as long as they don't direct it at me or seek to intrude on me. So, I did not find their quiet worship offensive in any way. I simply passed on my way and no one tried to collar me or address me. It was their moment alone and I left them to it. Is public space only for those things we personally agree with or that which makes us comfortable? And why should something that has nothing to do with me...like two lovers kissing in the park or people praying make me uncomfortable?
I couldn't care less if they are wearing headscarves, what I do care about is if they can call out the extremists that are part of their religion, because that what really matters to me.

I'm absolutely disgusted by so many ignorant comments lumping in millions of people together with a super lazy brush stroke. Anyone who's a minority that does something terrible, everyone of that ethnicity or religion are automatically stereotyped, even if it's committed by less than .0001% of a group. The first step in fascism is to dehumanize the "other", convince yourself that they're all cyborgs controlled by a mother ship. Pathetic, the whole lot of you making stupid demands and making guilty-until-proven-innocent assumptions. It's Un-American.

Nobody is saying that there aren't extremists and terrorists in other groups, we are just saying that why the most moderate Muslims are hesitant to call them out.  If they truly believe that such groups don't represent their kind, then they shouldn't be afraid to stand up to them.  Meanwhile, I have seen Jews, Christians, and other religious groups call out extremists who are on their end, but almost never for the Muslims.  In some cases there have been Muslims that have been killed just for calling out such groups like those Palestinians that were killed recently in the Gaza Strip just for protesting against Hamas.  Had more of the media covered that besides the Jerusalem Post and a few others, that would have exposed Hamas for who they really are.  Seriously, what are these comparisons?  What was done in Dresden was during a time of war, and that's something completely different to comparing it to a terrorist attack, which is usually done during a time of peace.  Also, the group known as Irgun, who was known for doing the Kind David Hotel bombing, there is more to know about that.  They never actually intended to kill anyone and they even give a prior warning to the British military that was there before even setting off the bomb and to evacuate before it went off, but they didn't seem to get that message.  However, the Arab extremists that were attacking the Jews never gave a warning and just shot and stabbed any Jew they saw at random.
Sixty Democrats helped the GOP by voting with them on limiting immigration. It's not just the far right.

GOP get a grip on your party and the hate it is spewing. Your latest incarnation is dangerously close to the worst of history's bad actors, and you're whipping this up for the basest reason--fear sells autoritarianism, esp in an election year.
Surely there is someone of wisdom and integrity to reel Trump (et al) in from his demogoguery before worse harm is done to our country.
The far-right is over the cliff and dragging moderate others with it.
Next it will be camps for Muslims? Trains to take them there? Naval blockades?
We are better than this. We must be better than this.

Are Christian white supremacists my brethren if I am a Christian? Do I need to "protest/control/disavow" every murderous individual who claims something in common with me? Do I need to be on the streets every time the U.S. government kills innocent civilians? – I'd never be able to go home...

This is something that I just don't get about the rest of the Muslims.  If they really don't believe that the terrorists are part of their group, then they shouldn't be afraid to call them out.  I could never understand why so many of them are hesitant to do so.  Are they afraid to be considered traitors to their own religion or even puppets of the Western World or even as they mention Zionists?  Let's not forget that in Europe that there were a number of recent terrorist attacks that were targeting Jews all over the continent especially in what they believe is oppression to the Palestinians, which can almost be viewed as being anti-Semitic and a hate crime.  Meanwhile, I have never seen or heard of any Jews attacking Muslims in revenge to Hamas launching rockets and doing other forms of attacks on Israeli civilians.  Another thing is that I can't get why the come to Europe and the US and almost never choose to assimilate or even respect other cultures when they have about 60 countries of their own to live in if they feel that they miss where they dominate so much rather than living elsewhere.  Also, they need to understand that they can't try to stay neutral on this issue forever, and they need to make a stand against such terrorists or many will feel that they do condone such acts.
